html:
11.28.18  7:48 am   In your new song, why is English considered real?

     i don't know but it says it isn't, in the 3rd verse

11.28.18  6:56 am   what movies should i watch?

     david attenboro looks at bugs and talks about them

11.28.18  6:53 am   In christmas isn't real there is a part in the video where there are a lot of "and" shown. Was it a way to trigger people who constatly complained about the use of this beautiful word?

     yes

      I found it funny, and great song as always pretty catchy

     that is nice of you

11.28.18  6:06 am   why is everything changing so quickly

     to gain an upper edge

11.28.18  6:04 am   was the big stack of "and"s at the material world is not enough part of your latest song poking fun at the people who say you use too many ands in your songs?

     yes

11.28.18  5:52 am   are there deeper meanings to everything you write that we do not understand? If so why don't you explain? 

     that depends which parts you already understand

11.28.18  2:21 am   Any reason you linked to the art track instead of Spotify in your tweet this time around?

     even the playing field a little

11.28.18  2:12 am   Can you math?

     yes

11.28.18  2:06 am   is New Year's Eve real

     yes

11.28.18  12:58 am   what is your life path number bill? mine is 3

     my ticket says 0 on one side and 1 on the other. no one has ever told me which is the correct side

11.28.18  12:53 am  
What got you into making youtube videos, and how can i get the epic victory royale?

     the trick is to make the video outside of youtube, and then all you gotta do is upload it to youtube, and pow everyone thinks it's a youtube video. even if you were not logged into youtube while making it

11.28.18  12:49 am   Will you ever do a "Hate comments" or "Hate mail" video? It'd be nice to, err, teach those people a lesson 

     i've done that, the video is called "fan mail"

11.28.18  12:31 am   Regarding the Maj7#11 question, what about Billy Joel's New York State of Mind? I'm not sure if I'm misunderstanding something, but that song seems to feature it and I think it works... What say you?

     just listened to the entire first verse and it's not there. just listened to the second verse and it's not there either. just listened to the entire bridge, it's not there. here's another verse, i doubt it will be here because all the verses are the same. seems it's not in the entire AABA, ... the song is long so i'm skipping through these verses cuz they seem to be all the same ... another bridge, ... whole song seems to be just these 2 sections, .... anything maj7#11 is virtually nowhere. ah, the second to last chord of the song uses it, not in the verse/bridge etc but just to end it. yes, that is where it usually makes sense, on a b2 chord. actually my first draft of the ending of 'long long long journey' used it this way, right before the end. i can't remember if i said this before but the main place that chord normally seems to work is on b2 chords, which makes sense because the 1 and 5 notes of the key would be those 2 notes it is supposed to have. commonly used on guitar in the key of E, you'd hear F with the high E and B strings still ringing.

11.27.18  11:57 pm   Do you have any book-recomendations or just general tips for someone who's really interested in learning to make chord progressions like you do?

     chords are used for music, not books. use music to learn it! find the chords in their natural habitat

11.27.18  11:56 pm   what is your favorite number

     1

      and why? 

     it's everything

11.27.18  11:43 pm   Do you ever think about thinking?

     not very much anymore

11.27.18  11:43 pm   What is your favorite drug?

     soap scum

11.27.18  11:24 pm   what prompts you to pull out the whopper vocabulary, like tenacious or embrightened? its almost like as wonky out-there chords are to harmony, those word choices are to lyrics

     at the time i came up with the 'tenacious' line, i did not know what the word meant. and 'embrightened' i just made up. i'm not sure if that's a word, it was just my own personal remix on the word 'enlightened / enlivened.' using words that feel like they make perfect sense even if you didn't think you had heard of them before, that's where the fun times are had in song writing

11.27.18  11:23 pm   Why do you like including a lot of flashy colors in your videos?

     i usually like the way it looks

11.27.18  11:21 pm   any thoughts about the pronunciation of "coupons"?

     normally i say 'coopons' but because consonants are extremely hard to clarify on audio recording (especially songs with instruments and drums playing) i felt it was important to say 'que-pons' to be more unmistake-able. also a nice twist

11.27.18  11:19 pm   why did you want to deliver a very against-the-grain perspective for a christmas song this time, with all the cynicism towards consumerism? it's rad, mind you, just wanna know what inspired that

     what cynicism against consumerism

11.27.18  10:47 pm   ethan's known for throwin' hard balls. u ready my nigga?

     the balls i am normally thrown are usually too soft

11.27.18  10:46 pm   why are spheres not cubes?

     because you said them differently

11.27.18  10:46 pm   Any hints on what the password for the reality page is?

     there is no password

11.27.18  10:38 pm   On Itunes a lot of your music is labelled pop. Do you think it's pop?

     hopefully

11.27.18  10:37 pm   Did you hardpan your voices in the middle of a sentence in your latest song? Unless I'm mistsken, you've never done that before.

     i do that on every song

     What made you do that?

     doubling and putting one on each side makes a nice full sound

11.27.18  10:36 pm   where did "Twitter Meme" come from? I always feel like your music exists out of time so to even see the word 'meme' mentioned in one of your songs is fascinating.

     there have been meme references in many of my songs and videos, as well as many references to time sensitive events and conditions

11.27.18  10:25 pm   Are you making any more shorts? i.e. maybe i could eat blades of grass, soap tips, etc.

     yes

11.27.18  10:25 pm   In "Christmas isn't Real", that part with the "ands" scrolling down against a rainbow background, is that in reference to so many people complaining about how much you use the word "And?"

     yes

11.27.18  10:24 pm   Is it true you're going to be on the h3h3 podcast?

     yes

11.27.18  9:06 pm   I'm torn between 2 paths, how do I know which one to choose? 

     you can only know which one you chose

11.27.18  9:04 pm   what if women are men with diseases that were only contagious during birth

     everyone is diseases

11.27.18  9:02 pm   Do you ever consider making songs apart from your main content that have more traditional / serious lyrics? Why?

     that is part of my repertoire which i use regularly. probably quite a bit in every song. also mix it in with newer things, or a bit of fun as well. this is generally a strategy that works well for virtually ever musical artist i have ever heard of, i think ....

11.27.18  8:58 pm   How does studio engineer Bill react when musician Bill can't nail the part?

     the frustration usually goes the other way

11.27.18  8:50 pm   Is there a one bar time signature change at the start of Christmas isn't real's chorus?

     no

      Any reason you included this? 

     i did not

11.27.18  8:14 pm   Would you say the Reality page is a good way to know you, besides here?

     somewhat

11.27.18  7:48 pm   Can we have the letters in the new song title?

     i just finished the last one and i have been answering questions ever since and after that need to sleep. the song choice will not be made until after that

11.27.18  7:47 pm   If Christmas isnt real, then how is the Easter Bunny?

     christmas is real, the easter bunny is probably not

11.27.18  7:45 pm   Have you ever went back on something you're typing and intentionally misspell it?

     no

11.27.18  7:31 pm   interesting choice to end some of your songs on non tonic chords that don't resolve. some would find it an unsatisfying end that leaves a bad taste in the listener's mouth. what made you decide that was the way it should be?

     if i think it leaves a 'good taste' in the listener's mouth, or more specifically their ear / mind and feelings

11.27.18  7:13 pm   I absolutely love the new song. I'm very curious about the time signature when you sing "ba da dee da da dee do". How would that be notated? Did you change from 4/4 to 7/8? It sounds so fascinating. Please enlighten me!

     it's all in 4 but it kind of pretends to be in 3 over the course of the same bar length. so triplets would probably do the trick. you could do &a1 a2e 3, (that's rigidly 16ths) or you could do &a1 let2trip 3 (using mostly triplets). in reality it's probably stretched somewhere in between those 2, but the time signature does not change

11.27.18  7:04 pm   In the latest song, you mentioned a lot more real world things such as Twitter and the Californian forest fires - as opposed from your other songs which seem relatively detached from reality. Was this a purposeful decision?

     i mention plenty of real things in other songs too. it's fun to mention real things, or fake things. even more fun to be somewhere in between sometimes

11.27.18  6:31 pm   when do you use capital letters and when do you dont?

     for acronyms, individual letters, or chord symbols. various other times, if i feel its necessary for clarity and/or communication. or just for fun

11.27.18  6:30 pm   does christmas is real?

     it's plausible

11.27.18  6:14 pm   Why isn't there a video for "Christmas Isn't Real"?

     there is

11.27.18  5:51 pm   Bill, I can see your new song on Spotify, but it is not yet on Youtube or your website. I have not yet listened to it, as I like to watch your content with the video before experiencing it through audio only. Is it intentional that you released it on Spotify first, or is this just an unfortunate side-effect of making sure the song rolls out on time on all platforms?

     side-effect

11.27.18  5:49 pm   whats the stupidest thing

     road cones. no that's not true, the stupidest thing is disrespecting road cones, which i almost just caught myself doing

11.27.18  5:34 pm   thoughts on watermelon?

     it's like eating and drinking at the same time

11.27.18  5:07 pm   So I've noticed myself having really specific problems with making content. A lot of times I'll feel anxious during the day and that's when I most want to make stuff, and I think of all these great ideas during times like class, but then afterward, when I actually have the opportunity to work, I'm so relieved and relaxed by the day being over that I can't call up the same emotions that I had during the day and therefore can't create anything genuine. Is this a problem you had to deal with at all, and if it was, is the solution to just wait until you're in a position where you make your own schedule, or is it something else? thanks

     you'll need to learn to write down / save the ideas you have when you are away from the studio. this is where most of your best ideas might start. so you'll want to get good at catching them. nowadays almost any phone has more than enough capability to do this. just sing a quick demo and explain everything you need to know about the idea, and then when you get home add it to the list with a reference to the audio file / note

11.27.18  5:02 pm   Why can't I stop procrastinating?

     because you are terrified of doing a certain thing
